title: Exponential Growth
text: A function that models exponential growth grows by a rate proportional to the amount present. For any real number $$x$$ and any positive real numbers a and $$b$$ such that $$b \neq 1$$, an exponential growth function has the form $$f(x)=a b^x$$\nwhere a is the initial or starting value of the function and $$b$$ is the growth factor or growth multiplier per unit $$x$$ .

title: Defining the Exponential Model
text: The function for exponential growth is given by $$f(x)=a b^x$$. What is exponential model, f(x), for this question?

title: Defining the Exponential Model
text: The function for exponential growth is given by $$f(x)=a b^x$$. What is the initial or starting value of the function, a?

title: Defining the Exponential Model
text: The function for exponential growth is given by $$f(x)=a b^x$$. What is the growth factor or growth multiplier per unit $$x$$, $$b$$?

title: Period of Growth
text: How many years ahead are we trying to predict with our model?

title: Using Substitution
text: Substitute $$x=8$$ into f(x) to evaluate the fox population in the year $$2020$$.
